{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3350574,"name":"Jack Tajkef","username":"jacktajkef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacktajkef/{size}/193592_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T18:33:24.429Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone,

This might be a stupid question but we are having a lot of trouble getting the robot to start at an angle. We are running MK4i modules with a navX, and everything works great, but we can’t start at an angle (the sides of the subwoofer). We have pathplanner working with no issues, but we can only start at the center position. If we want to start at an angle, we have to turn on the robot facing the opposing alliance, then pick up and rotate the robot to its position so that it has a zero heading facing the other alliance.

How do we set it up so that it takes the starting pose from Pathplanner and uses that heading to drive the robot? Any help would be greatly appreciated.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T18:33:24.429Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":74,"reads":513,"readers_count":512,"score":472.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":461074,"topic_slug":"starting-a-match-at-an-angle","display_username":"Jack Tajkef","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51555,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 7415 | President"},"post_url":"/t/starting-a-match-at-an-angle/461074/1","custom_user_title":"Team 7415 | President","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3350581,"name":"John Fogarty","username":"JohnFogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T18:36:45.847Z","cooked":"

https://pathplanner.dev/gui-editing-paths-and-autos.html#autos

Look at preset starting pose.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T18:36:45.847Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":477,"readers_count":476,"score":100.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461074,"topic_slug":"starting-a-match-at-an-angle","display_username":"John Fogarty","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://pathplanner.dev/gui-editing-paths-and-autos.html#autos","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Editing Paths and Autos | PathPlanner Docs","clicks":38}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12688,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/starting-a-match-at-an-angle/461074/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350588,"name":"Jack Tajkef","username":"jacktajkef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacktajkef/{size}/193592_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T18:39:40.777Z","cooked":"

Thanks. We have the starting pose set and it does that correctly. How do we make it so that it drives in teleop using the correct starting pose rotation (instead of the zero pose that the robot would have when starting up the bot)?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T18:39:40.777Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":437,"readers_count":436,"score":92.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461074,"topic_slug":"starting-a-match-at-an-angle","display_username":"Jack Tajkef","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12688,"username":"JohnFogarty","name":"John Fogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51555,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 7415 | President"},"post_url":"/t/starting-a-match-at-an-angle/461074/3","custom_user_title":"Team 7415 | President","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350591,"name":"John Fogarty","username":"JohnFogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T18:42:29.183Z","cooked":"

If you put the robot in the starting position defined in your Auto and when autonomous mode starts the pose will get reset to that starting position. This is assuming you are using auto builder.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T18:42:29.183Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":381,"readers_count":380,"score":101.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":461074,"topic_slug":"starting-a-match-at-an-angle","display_username":"John Fogarty","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51555,"username":"jacktajkef","name":"Jack Tajkef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacktajkef/{size}/193592_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12688,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/starting-a-match-at-an-angle/461074/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350595,"name":"Jack Tajkef","username":"jacktajkef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacktajkef/{size}/193592_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T18:44:24.748Z","cooked":"

Yes, we are. The problem is that if we start the robot at the angle, the robot will set the angled starting position as the zero, and will drive with that being forward in teleop.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T18:44:24.748Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":347,"readers_count":346,"score":79.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461074,"topic_slug":"starting-a-match-at-an-angle","display_username":"Jack Tajkef","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12688,"username":"JohnFogarty","name":"John Fogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51555,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 7415 | President"},"post_url":"/t/starting-a-match-at-an-angle/461074/5","custom_user_title":"Team 7415 | President","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350609,"name":"Jim Barstow","username":"JimB1918","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimb1918/{size}/166841_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T18:55:52.596Z","cooked":"

You have to use an offset to your yaw to correct for this zero position.

While it may not be the best way, you can see how we do it in our Gyro class… 2024Crescendo/src/main/java/frc/team1918/robot/classes/Gyro.java at dev · ncgears/2024Crescendo · GitHub

Specifically, look at the getYaw() and setYawOffset(double offset) methods.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T18:55:52.596Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":291,"readers_count":290,"score":73.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":461074,"topic_slug":"starting-a-match-at-an-angle","display_username":"Jim Barstow","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/ncgears/2024Crescendo/blob/dev/src/main/java/frc/team1918/robot/classes/Gyro.java","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"2024Crescendo/src/main/java/frc/team1918/robot/classes/Gyro.java at dev · ncgears/2024Crescendo · GitHub","clicks":14}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":51555,"username":"jacktajkef","name":"Jack Tajkef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacktajkef/{size}/193592_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51835,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"M(Code, Elec), CSA/FTAA"},"post_url":"/t/starting-a-match-at-an-angle/461074/6","custom_user_title":"M(Code, Elec), CSA/FTAA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350637,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T19:17:04.836Z","cooked":"

You should check the resetPose consumer you’re passing to PathPlanner. PathPlanner just calls your method and it’s up to you to reset the pose (including the rotation). I’ve seen a few teams’ code where they reset the gyro to zero, but don’t reset their odometry/pose estimator.

You’re resetPose method needs to properly reset the robot’s pose with SwerveDrivePoseEstimator.resetPosition() or SwerveDriveOdometry.resetPosition(). There shouldn’t be any place that you reset the gyro without also resetting the position.

Can you share your code?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T19:17:04.836Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":236,"readers_count":235,"score":47.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":461074,"topic_slug":"starting-a-match-at-an-angle","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/math/kinematics/SwerveDriveOdometry.html#resetPosition(edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d,edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModulePosition%5B%5D,edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d)","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"SwerveDriveOdometry (WPILib API 2024.3.2)","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/starting-a-match-at-an-angle/461074/7","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350649,"name":"Austin Muse","username":"Truffle_Shuffle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truffle_shuffle/{size}/195035_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T19:23:03.683Z","cooked":"

So we use a navX and it sets it zero on start up. So we set our robot square against the drive station wall and start up the robot. Give it a solid 20 seconds to calibrate and start up, then move it to the angle you want against the subwoofer, the heading should be good to go.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T19:23:03.683Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":192,"readers_count":191,"score":63.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461074,"topic_slug":"starting-a-match-at-an-angle","display_username":"Austin Muse","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59486,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead Mentor-9067 The Goonies"},"post_url":"/t/starting-a-match-at-an-angle/461074/8","custom_user_title":"Lead Mentor-9067 The Goonies","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350718,"name":"Jack Tajkef","username":"jacktajkef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacktajkef/{size}/193592_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T20:15:34.451Z","cooked":"

That’s what we do too but is there a way to do that without having to spin the robot?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T20:15:34.451Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":149,"readers_count":148,"score":34.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461074,"topic_slug":"starting-a-match-at-an-angle","display_username":"Jack Tajkef","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59486,"username":"Truffle_Shuffle","name":"Austin Muse","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truffle_shuffle/{size}/195035_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51555,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 7415 | President"},"post_url":"/t/starting-a-match-at-an-angle/461074/9","custom_user_title":"Team 7415 | President","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350726,"name":"Jim Barstow","username":"JimB1918","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimb1918/{size}/166841_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T20:17:53.773Z","cooked":"

We place the robot however, vision corrects the pose, and we set the offset at the beginning of auton based on the detected pose. We do not need to re-zero at teleop.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T20:17:53.773Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":142,"readers_count":141,"score":48.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461074,"topic_slug":"starting-a-match-at-an-angle","display_username":"Jim Barstow","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":51555,"username":"jacktajkef","name":"Jack Tajkef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacktajkef/{size}/193592_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51835,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"M(Code, Elec), CSA/FTAA"},"post_url":"/t/starting-a-match-at-an-angle/461074/10","custom_user_title":"M(Code, Elec), CSA/FTAA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350729,"name":"Jack Tajkef","username":"jacktajkef","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jacktajkef/{size}/193592_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T20:20:11.788Z","cooked":"

When you get the rotation value from your gyro for swerve, do you pull the rotation value directly from the gyro or from the robot odometry?

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2024-04-02T20:20:11.788Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":35.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":461074,"topic_slug":"starting-a-match-at-an-angle","display_username":"Jack Tajkef","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51835,"username":"JimB1918","name":"Jim Barstow","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimb1918/{size}/166841_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51555,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 7415 | President"},"post_url":"/t/starting-a-match-at-an-angle/461074/11","custom_user_title":"Team 7415 | President","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3350734,"name":"Jim Barstow","username":"JimB1918","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimb1918/{size}/166841_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-02T20:21:47.615Z","cooked":"

We use the getYaw() method in our gyro class, which adds the offset saved during auto init. I linked the code earlier for you to see this.

I just read this again, and I now understand what you’re saying. You’re saying the robot drives correct in auto with PathPlanner, but in teleop it doesn’t drive the right direction.

I would be willing to bet this is because you are using your gyro heading for driving, not the rotation from odometry. As pointed out by others, the gyro will start at 0, then PathPlanner will tell your odometry the angle where the path starts. Your code probably sets the odometry angle, but the gyro is still zero (this is how it should work.)

The simplest fix is to use the angle of your odometry pose for field relative driving instead of using the gyro directly.
